clinical_study.brief_title: Relapse-Prevention Booklets as an Adjunct to a Tobacco Telephone Helpline("Quitline")
clinical_study.official_title: Relapse-Prevention Booklets as an Adjunct to a Tobacco Quitline

lead_sponsor.agency: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

clinical_study.source: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: The study primary purpose is smoking relapse prevention. This study is a collaboration between researchers who developed the relapse-prevention intervention, at the H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center in Tampa, Florida, and those associated with the "New York State Smokers' Quitline" (NYSSQL), at Roswell Park Cancer Institute in Buffalo, New York.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, approximately 3400 quitline clients will be randomized to one of three conditions at the point of their 2-week follow-up call. One-third will be randomized to a Usual Care (UC) condition, which will receive regular quitline services. One-third will be randomized to a Repeated Mailings (RM) condition, which will receive the 8 Forever Free booklets sent by mail at regular intervals over a period of 12 months. And one-third will be randomized to a Massed Mailings (MM) condition, which will receive all 8 booklets in a single mailing.

primary_outcome.measure: 7-Day Point-Prevalence Abstinence at Each Follow-up Point
primary_outcome.description: To test the effectiveness of a self-help, relapse-prevention intervention (Forever Free booklets) as an adjunct to a state telephone quitline

arm_group.description: Receive the 8 Forever Free booklets sent by mail at regular intervals over a period of 12 months
Receive all 8 booklets in a single mailing

intervention.description: Approximately 3400 quitline clients will be randomized to one of three conditions at the point of their 2-week follow-up call.
